CatDescriptText: Ruth Kennedy, housewife, 6220 Ossipee Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 4, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that theatrical productions like 'The Green Pastures,' which 'take-off' on religions, should be presented as entertainment?" answer reads: "In my opinion, whoever created that mess called 'The Green Pastures' should have left the Bible alone. The way Negroes were clowning was awful.  They really made a mess out of the Bible."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ruth Kennedy wearing dark square patterned coat, light colored hat, and light colored gloves, standing on sidewalk in front of wire fence and notary public
